speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: SCENE I. Before PAGE'S house.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS PAGE, with a letter

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: What, have I scaped love-letters in the holiday-

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: time of my beauty, and am I now a subject for them?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Let me see.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Reads

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: 'Ask me no reason why I love you; for though

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Love use Reason for his physician, he admits him

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: not for his counsellor. You are not young, no more

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: am I; go to then, there's sympathy: you are merry,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: so am I; ha, ha! then there's more sympathy: you

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: love sack, and so do I; would you desire better

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: sympathy? Let it suffice thee, Mistress Page,--at

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: the least, if the love of soldier can suffice,--

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: that I love thee. I will not say, pity me; 'tis

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: not a soldier-like phrase: but I say, love me. By me,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Thine own true knight,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: By day or night,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Or any kind of light,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: With all his might

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: For thee to fight,    JOHN FALSTAFF'

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: What a Herod of Jewry is this! O wicked

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: world! One that is well-nigh worn to pieces with

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: age to show himself a young gallant! What an

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: unweighed behavior hath this Flemish drunkard

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: picked--with the devil's name!--out of my

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: conversation, that he dares in this manner assay me?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Why, he hath not been thrice in my company! What

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: should I say to him? I was then frugal of my

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: mirth: Heaven forgive me! Why, I'll exhibit a bill

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: in the parliament for the putting down of men. How

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: shall I be revenged on him? for revenged I will be,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: as sure as his guts are made of puddings.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS FORD

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Mistress Page! trust me, I was going to your house.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And, trust me, I was coming to you. You look very

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: ill.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Nay, I'll ne'er believe that; I have to show to the contrary.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Faith, but you do, in my mind.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Well, I do then; yet I say I could show you to the

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: contrary. O Mistress Page, give me some counsel!

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: What's the matter, woman?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: O woman, if it were not for one trifling respect, I

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: could come to such honour!

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Hang the trifle, woman! take the honour. What is

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: it? dispense with trifles; what is it?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: If I would but go to hell for an eternal moment or so,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: I could be knighted.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: What? thou liest! Sir Alice Ford! These knights

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: will hack; and so thou shouldst not alter the

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: article of thy gentry.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: We burn daylight: here, read, read; perceive how I

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: might be knighted. I shall think the worse of fat

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: men, as long as I have an eye to make difference of

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: men's liking: and yet he would not swear; praised

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: women's modesty; and gave such orderly and

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: well-behaved reproof to all uncomeliness, that I

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: would have sworn his disposition would have gone to

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: the truth of his words; but they do no more adhere

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: and keep place together than the Hundredth Psalm to

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: the tune of 'Green Sleeves.' What tempest, I trow,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: threw this whale, with so many tuns of oil in his

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: belly, ashore at Windsor? How shall I be revenged

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: on him? I think the best way were to entertain him

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: with hope, till the wicked fire of lust have melted

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: him in his own grease. Did you ever hear the like?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Letter for letter, but that the name of Page and

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Ford differs! To thy great comfort in this mystery

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: of ill opinions, here's the twin-brother of thy

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: letter: but let thine inherit first; for, I

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: protest, mine never shall. I warrant he hath a

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: thousand of these letters, writ with blank space for

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: different names--sure, more,--and these are of the

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: second edition: he will print them, out of doubt;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: for he cares not what he puts into the press, when

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: he would put us two. I had rather be a giantess,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: and lie under Mount Pelion. Well, I will find you

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: twenty lascivious turtles ere one chaste man.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Why, this is the very same; the very hand, the very

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: words. What doth he think of us?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Nay, I know not: it makes me almost ready to

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: wrangle with mine own honesty. I'll entertain

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: myself like one that I am not acquainted withal;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: for, sure, unless he know some strain in me, that I

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: know not myself, he would never have boarded me in this fury.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: 'Boarding,' call you it? I'll be sure to keep him

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: above deck.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: So will I if he come under my hatches, I'll never

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: to sea again. Let's be revenged on him: let's

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: appoint him a meeting; give him a show of comfort in

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: his suit and lead him on with a fine-baited delay,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: till he hath pawned his horses to mine host of the Garter.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Nay, I will consent to act any villany against him,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: that may not sully the chariness of our honesty. O,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: that my husband saw this letter! it would give

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: eternal food to his jealousy.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Why, look where he comes; and my good man too: he's

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: as far from jealousy as I am from giving him cause;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: and that I hope is an unmeasurable distance.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: You are the happier woman.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Let's consult together against this greasy knight.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Come hither.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: They retire

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Enter FORD with PISTOL, and PAGE with NYM

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Well, I hope it be not so.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Hope is a curtal dog in some affairs:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Sir John affects thy wife.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Why, sir, my wife is not young.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: He wooes both high and low, both rich and poor,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Both young and old, one with another, Ford;

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: He loves the gallimaufry: Ford, perpend.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Love my wife!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: With liver burning hot. Prevent, or go thou,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Like Sir Actaeon he, with Ringwood at thy heels:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: O, odious is the name!

speaker: FORD
text_entry: What name, sir?

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: The horn, I say. Farewell.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Take heed, have open eye, for thieves do foot by night:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Take heed, ere summer comes or cuckoo-birds do sing.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Away, Sir Corporal Nym!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Believe it, Page; he speaks sense.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FORD
text_entry: [Aside]  I will be patient; I will find out this.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: [To PAGE]  And this is true; I like not the humour

speaker: NYM
text_entry: of lying. He hath wronged me in some humours: I

speaker: NYM
text_entry: should have borne the humoured letter to her; but I

speaker: NYM
text_entry: have a sword and it shall bite upon my necessity.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: He loves your wife; there's the short and the long.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: My name is Corporal Nym; I speak and I avouch; 'tis

speaker: NYM
text_entry: true: my name is Nym and Falstaff loves your wife.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: Adieu. I love not the humour of bread and cheese,

speaker: NYM
text_entry: and there's the humour of it. Adieu.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: 'The humour of it,' quoth a'! here's a fellow

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: frights English out of his wits.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I will seek out Falstaff.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: I never heard such a drawling, affecting rogue.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: If I do find it: well.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: I will not believe such a Cataian, though the priest

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: o' the town commended him for a true man.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: 'Twas a good sensible fellow: well.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: How now, Meg!

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: MISTRESS PAGE and MISTRESS FORD come forward

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Whither go you, George? Hark you.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: How now, sweet Frank! why art thou melancholy?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I melancholy! I am not melancholy. Get you home, go.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Faith, thou hast some crotchets in thy head. Now,

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: will you go, Mistress Page?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Have with you. You'll come to dinner, George.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Aside to MISTRESS FORD

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Look who comes yonder: she shall be our messenger

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: to this paltry knight.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: [Aside to MISTRESS PAGE]  Trust me, I thought on her:

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: she'll fit it.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS QUICKLY

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: You are come to see my daughter Anne?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Ay, forsooth; and, I pray, how does good Mistress Anne?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Go in with us and see: we have an hour's talk with

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: you.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Exeunt MISTRESS PAGE, MISTRESS FORD, and MISTRESS QUICKLY

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: How now, Master Ford!

speaker: FORD
text_entry: You heard what this knave told me, did you not?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Yes: and you heard what the other told me?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Do you think there is truth in them?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Hang 'em, slaves! I do not think the knight would

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: offer it: but these that accuse him in his intent

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: towards our wives are a yoke of his discarded men;

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: very rogues, now they be out of service.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Were they his men?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Marry, were they.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I like it never the better for that. Does he lie at

speaker: FORD
text_entry: the Garter?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Ay, marry, does he. If he should intend this voyage

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: towards my wife, I would turn her loose to him; and

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: what he gets more of her than sharp words, let it

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: lie on my head.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I do not misdoubt my wife; but I would be loath to

speaker: FORD
text_entry: turn them together. A man may be too confident: I

speaker: FORD
text_entry: would have nothing lie on my head: I cannot be thus satisfied.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Look where my ranting host of the Garter comes:

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: there is either liquor in his pate or money in his

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: purse when he looks so merrily.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Enter Host

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: How now, mine host!

speaker: Host
text_entry: How now, bully-rook! thou'rt a gentleman.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Cavaleiro-justice, I say!

speaker: Host
text_entry: Enter SHALLOW

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: I follow, mine host, I follow. Good even and

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: twenty, good Master Page! Master Page, will you go

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: with us? we have sport in hand.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Tell him, cavaleiro-justice; tell him, bully-rook.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Sir, there is a fray to be fought between Sir Hugh

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: the Welsh priest and Caius the French doctor.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Good mine host o' the Garter, a word with you.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Drawing him aside

speaker: Host
text_entry: What sayest thou, my bully-rook?

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: [To PAGE]  Will you go with us to behold it? My

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: merry host hath had the measuring of their weapons;

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: and, I think, hath appointed them contrary places;

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: for, believe me, I hear the parson is no jester.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Hark, I will tell you what our sport shall be.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: They converse apart

speaker: Host
text_entry: Hast thou no suit against my knight, my

speaker: Host
text_entry: guest-cavaleire?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: None, I protest: but I'll give you a pottle of

speaker: FORD
text_entry: burnt sack to give me recourse to him and tell him

speaker: FORD
text_entry: my name is Brook; only for a jest.

speaker: Host
text_entry: My hand, bully; thou shalt have egress and regress;

speaker: Host
text_entry: --said I well?--and thy name shall be Brook. It is

speaker: Host
text_entry: a merry knight. Will you go, An-heires?

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Have with you, mine host.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: I have heard the Frenchman hath good skill in

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: his rapier.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Tut, sir, I could have told you more. In these times

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: you stand on distance, your passes, stoccadoes, and

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: I know not what: 'tis the heart, Master Page; 'tis

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: here, 'tis here. I have seen the time, with my long

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: sword I would have made you four tall fellows skip like rats.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Here, boys, here, here! shall we wag?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Have with you. I would rather hear them scold than fight.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Exeunt Host, SHALLOW, and PAGE

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Though Page be a secure fool, an stands so firmly

speaker: FORD
text_entry: on his wife's frailty, yet I cannot put off my

speaker: FORD
text_entry: opinion so easily: she was in his company at Page's

speaker: FORD
text_entry: house; and what they made there, I know not. Well,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I will look further into't: and I have a disguise

speaker: FORD
text_entry: to sound Falstaff. If I find her honest, I lose not

speaker: FORD
text_entry: my labour; if she be otherwise, 'tis labour well bestowed.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Exit
